newsitem.title: USA: US West Coast prods mostly flat in idle trade.
newsitem.headline: US West Coast prods mostly flat in idle trade.

text.p: Spot trade for U.S. West Coast products was generally flat Friday, with prices unchanged after traders abandoned the market early for the weekend, brokers said.
Brokers said few deals got done Friday, with one rumored for Los Angeles CARB gasoline at 73.50 cents a gallon.
Trade was also subdued as NYMEX prices reversed a recent rebound and ended the day lower, ahead of March expiry.
March NYMEX heating oil fell 1.27 cents a gallon to 54.76 cents while gasoline dropped 1.02 cents to 61.65 cents.
Prices were expected to fall Monday, brokers said, with refineries soon ending their spring maintenance shutdowns and pipeline scheduling over for the first cycle of March gasoline.
CARB gasoline in Los Angeles was notionally one cent lower at 73/74 cents, with San Francisco grade flat at 71/72 cents a gallon.
Conventional grades in both cities stayed flat with regular unleaded gasoline 69/71 cents in L.A..
Distillates were also flat amid extremely thin trade.
